The detected 'backtick execution' patterns are markdown code fences. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' patterns are hex color codes (#3182CE, #1A365D) used for CSS styling. content.value_statement: Users struggle to transform complex educational content into engaging visual formats. This skill generates structured knowledge comics with multiple art styles, character consistency, and professional panel layouts for tutorials, biographies, and educational stories.
actual_capabilities: Generates educational comics with 7 visual styles including Ligne Claire, dramatic, warm, tech, sepia, vibrant, and Ohmsha manga
Creates consistent character definitions with reference sheets and color palettes across all panels
Produces structured outlines with 5-25 pages depending on content complexity
Supports 6 layout types: standard, cinematic, dense, splash, mixed, and webtoon
Auto-detects optimal style and layout based on content signals like tutorial, biography, or conflict themes
Integrates with image generation skills to output panel-by-panel comic pages
limitations: Requires separate image generation skill to create actual visual outputs
Cannot verify historical accuracy of depicted events or figures
Character appearances depend on AI image generator capabilities and reference quality

use_cases.title: Explain Complex Topics
use_cases.description: Transform textbook chapters or scientific concepts into engaging visual comics for students.

use_cases.title: Build Visual Stories
use_cases.description: Create biography comics about historical figures or tutorial narratives in manga style.

use_cases.title: Simplify Technical Content
use_cases.description: Convert AI, programming, or computing concepts into accessible visual explanations.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Comic Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a knowledge comic about [TOPIC] using the classic style and standard layout. Target audience: [BEGINNERS/INTERMEDIATES]. Length: [SHORT/MEDIUM/LONG].

prompt_templates.title: Manga Style Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an Ohmsha-style educational manga about [TOPIC]. Use the webtoon layout. Include default Ohmsha characters. Focus on visual metaphors and action scenes, not talking heads.

prompt_templates.title: Technical Deep Dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a tech-themed knowledge comic about [COMPUTING TOPIC]. Use tech style with dense layout. Include diagrams for neural networks, algorithms, or data flow concepts.

prompt_templates.title: Historical Biography
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a biography comic about [HISTORICAL FIGURE]. Use classic style with mixed layout. Span [TIME PERIOD]. Define 3-4 main characters with consistent appearance across [N] pages.

output_examples.input: Create a 10-page comic about the history of computing using the tech style
output: Title: Computing History | Style: tech | Pages: 10
Panels per page: 4-6 | Visual prompts: 00-cover.png through 09-page.png

output_examples.input: Make an Ohmsha manga about machine learning basics
output: Title: Machine Learning Basics | Style: ohmsha | Layout: webtoon
Page Count: 8 | Format: sequential vertical scroll
Visual metaphors: glowing nodes, luminous particles, geometric patterns

output_examples.input: Generate a biography comic about Alan Turing
output: Title: The Imitation Game | Style: classic | Layout: mixed
Characters: Alan Turing (age variants: young, adult, later), The Bombe Machine
Pages: 16 | Color Palette: muted browns (#8B7355), navy blue (#2C3E50)
Covers: period-accurate 1940s details, tweed jackets, Bletchley Park setting

best_practices: Provide detailed character descriptions with specific appearance traits, color codes, and expression ranges to maintain visual consistency
Match style and layout to content type: Ohmsha for tutorials, tech for computing, dramatic for breakthrough moments
Include visual metaphors for abstract concepts like neural networks, algorithms, and data flow in appropriate panels
anti_patterns: Using inconsistent character descriptions across pages breaks visual continuity and confuses readers
Overloading panels with text defeats the visual purpose of comic storytelling
Ignoring style-specific guidelines like avoiding talking heads in Ohmsha manga results in low-quality output

faq.question: What image generation skill works with baoyu-comic?
faq.answer: baoyu-comic generates prompts and structure. Use baoyu-gemini-web or other image generation skills to create the actual comic panels.

faq.question: How many pages can baoyu-comic generate?
faq.answer: Short stories: 5-8 pages. Medium complexity: 9-15 pages. Full biographies: 16-25 pages.

faq.question: Can I use my own characters?
faq.answer: Yes. Define characters in characters/characters.md with appearance, costume, and expression specifications. Reference sheet generated automatically.

faq.question: What styles work best for technical content?
faq.answer: Tech style with dense layout is optimized for computing, AI, and programming topics. Includes circuit motifs and grid patterns.

faq.question: Does baoyu-comic handle Chinese content?
faq.answer: Yes. Full Chinese support with proper full-width punctuation (Ôºå„ÄÇÔºÅ) and Chinese text rendering in speech bubbles.

faq.question: Can I combine different layouts in one comic?
faq.answer: Yes. The mixed layout option allows varying layouts per page. You can also manually specify layouts in the outline.
